text: <extra_id_0> Bcl-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression in reactive follicular hyperplasia , follicular lymphoma , and angioimmunoblastic T-cell lymphoma with hyperplastic germinal centers : heterogeneity of intrafollicular T-cells and their altered distribution in the pathogenesis of angioimmunoblastic T-cell lymphoma .

BACKGROUND : The <extra_id_0> Bcl-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene product , a nuclear phosphoprotein , is expressed independently of <extra_id_0> Bcl-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene rearrangement .

In lymph nodes , expression of <extra_id_0> Bcl-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> protein is restricted to germinal center ( GC ) B-cells and 10 % to 15 % of CD3 / <extra_id_0> CD4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + intrafollicular T cells .
Interfollicular cells are negative for <extra_id_0> Bcl-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> protein , except for rare CD3+ / <extra_id_0> CD4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + T cells .

Recently , we reported cases of angioimmunoblastic T-cell lymphoma ( AITL ) with hyperplastic GCs ( AITL / GC ) , and observed that borders of enlarged GCs were ill defined , with features suggestive of an outward migration of GC cells to surrounding interfollicular zones .
This prompted a study of follicular borders with <extra_id_0> Bcl-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> staining in reactive follicular hyperplasias and follicular lymphomas to compare with AITL / GC .
MATERIALS AND METHODS : Formalin-fixed paraffin sections were used for immunostaining of <extra_id_0> Bcl-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
Six cases of AITL / GC , 12 nonspecific reactive follicular hyperplasia ( FH ) , 7 HIV adenopathy , 10 follicular lymphoma ( FL ) , and 8 typical AITL ( ie , AITL without GC ) were studied .

Double staining for <extra_id_0> Bcl-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> CD20 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> Bcl-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / CD3 , and <extra_id_0> Bcl-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> CD57 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> was performed in selected cases .

RESULTS : In FH and HIV adenopathy , staining for <extra_id_0> Bcl-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> revealed densely populated GCs with well-defined and regular GC borders , whereas <extra_id_0> Bcl-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + cells were rare in the interfollicular areas .
An occasional GC with an ill-defined border was invariably surrounded by a broad mantle zone ; those with indistinct mantle zones had well-defined , regular borders .
In FL , follicles were densely populated , and their borders were irregular , with some <extra_id_0> Bcl-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + cells in the interfollicular zones .

In AITL / GC , GCs were less dense , GC borders were ill defined and irregular , and the number of interfollicular <extra_id_0> Bcl-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + cells was markedly increased .

Double staining revealed that these interfollicular <extra_id_0> Bcl-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + cells in AITL / GC were <extra_id_0> Bcl6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + / CD3+ / <extra_id_0> CD20 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - / <extra_id_0> CD57 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - T cells .
Moreover , CD3+ intrafollicular T cells were depleted in AITL / GC , whereas they were abundant in FH .
Intrafollicular <extra_id_0> CD57 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + cells did not stain for <extra_id_0> Bcl-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and were also depleted in AITL / GC .
In typical AITL , some neoplastic cells were positive for <extra_id_0> Bcl-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , showing variable degrees of staining .

CONCLUSIONS : ( 1 ) GCs of AITL / GC differed from those of other reactive follicular hyperplasias and follicular lymphomas , and staining for <extra_id_0> Bcl-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> was useful to discern them .

( 2 ) Intrafollicular CD3+ T cells , many of which were also positive for <extra_id_0> Bcl-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , were markedly depleted in AITL / GC , with increased interfollicular <extra_id_0> Bcl-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + / CD3+ cells , suggesting an outward migration of intrafollicular T cells in this condition .
( 3 ) Interfollicular <extra_id_0> Bcl-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + / CD3+ cells in AITL / GC were too numerous to be accounted for by migration alone , suggesting local proliferation .

( 4 ) Intrafollicular <extra_id_0> CD57 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + cells were negative for <extra_id_0> Bcl-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , indicating heterogeneity of the intrafollicular T-cell population .

( 5 ) Some neoplastic cells in AITL stained for <extra_id_0> Bcl-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , suggesting up-regulation of <extra_id_0> Bcl-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression in this tumor .
